description: Ms. codex. Title from audition statement on fol. 1a. 29 lines per page. Written in medium small casual naskh in black ink with use of red for headings. Light cream paper with laid and chain lines visible. Marginal annotations (mostly collation notes by the same hand as the main text). The text of the reading statement (samāʻ note) is inlaid in the firt fol. Fol. 2-3 are blank, frame-ruled. Two spine labels with blue border, reading respectively "Tahdhīb al-Tahdhīb lil-ʻAsqalānī" in Arabic script and "164" in Arabic and Roman script. Lacunae after fol. 304, 312, 321. Origin: Copy completed by Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Jaʻfar ibn Mukhtār al-shahīr bi-Ibn Qamar al-Ḥusaynī al-Shāfiʻī (see description note), on a Wednesday at the end of Shaʻbān 835 [April 1432] (colophon, fol. 327a). Collation: Paper, fol. 327 ; iii (fol. 1-3) 1-30¹⁰ 31¹⁰ (-1, after fol. 312, apparently with loss of text) 32¹⁰ (-1, after fol. 321, apparently with loss of text) 33⁶ ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Beginning as extant: لضيعه له وقال ابو حاتم كان يطير النفسالى(؟) فى الصدر ... احمد بن عبد الواحد بن وافد التميمى المعروف بابن عبود الدمشقى Explicit: ارواح النبى صلى الله عليه وسلم ان يدخل عليهن احد -لك الرضاعةاخر الكتاب والحمد لله ... قال شيخنا حافظ العصر ... قال مولفه يعنى مولف الاصل فرغت منه ... سنة اثنتى عشرة وسبعماية واقام فى عمله ثمان سنين ... وكان الفراغ من اختصاره يوم الاربعا تاسع جمادى الاخرة سنة ثمان وثمان ماية على يد مختصره احمد بن على بن محمد بن محمد بن على العسقلانى الاصل ثم المصرى الشافعى المذهب عفا الله عنه والحمد لله حمدا كثيرا كما ينبغى ... والصلاة والسلام ... الى يوم الدين وحسبنا الله ونعم الوكيل
author: Ibn Ḥajar al-ʻAsqalānī, Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī, 1372-1449
abstract: Aceph. and incomplete copy of an abridgment of Tahdhīb al-kamāl fī maʻrifat al-rijāl, a summary by Jamāl al-Dīn Yūsuf ibn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Mizzī (d. 742/1341) of al-Kamāl fī maʻrifat al-rijāl by Taqī al-Dīn al-Jammāʻīlī (d. 600/1203). This copy contains a reading statement signed by the author, refering to Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad al-maʻrūf bi-Ibn Ḥusān (Jerusalem, Ṣafar 800 - Cairo, Rabīʻ al-Awwal 855 [1397-1451] ; see Sakhāwī, al-Ḍawʼ al-lāmiʻ, ed. 1934, vol. 9, p. 152-153), Muḥammad ibn ʻAlī ibn Jaʻfar ibn Mukhtār al-shahīr bi-Ibn Qamar al-Ḥusaynī (Cairo, d. 13 Jumādá al-Ūlá 876 [1471], see Sakhāwī, al-Ḍawʼ al-lāmiʻ, ed. 1934, vol. 8, p. 172), Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Zayn al-Dīn ʻAbd al-Raḥmān al-Sakhāwī (d. Shaʻbān 902 [1497]), dated Ramaḍān 852(?) [1448] (fol. 1a).
extent: 327 leaves: paper ; 271 x 183 (192 x 135) mm. bound to 273 x 187 mm.
provenance: Acquired by Robert Garrett from Mūrad Bey Bārūdī, Beirut, 1925.
